desc.p: This advanaced function searches the TEI XML records for all testimonia.
You may wish to expand your search by using wildcard characters to increase results. See search tips for more details.

input.label: Keyword
input.name: keyword
input.title: Use this box to search for keywords anywhere in the testimonia.

input.label: Title
input.name: title
input.title: Use this box to search only within titles.

input.label: Author
input.name: author
input.title: Use this box to search only within author names.

input.label: Place Name
input.name: placeName
input.title: Use this box to search only within place names.
input.placeholder: Search by keywords in place names...

search-tips.p: Given the prevalence of variant spellings in names, using Wildcard Characters may help.
"?" can be inserted as a variant for any single character.

div.p:
Thus a search for:
Procopi?s
returns results which contain either "Procopius" or "Procopios".

search-tips.p: "*" can be inserted as a variant for multiple characters or a truncated word.

div.p:
Thus a search for:
Καισαρ*
returns results for "Καισαρείᾳ" and "Καισαρέων" and more.

p.small: Note: Because the sources we draw upon use a variety of transliteration formats, Caesarea-Maritima.org ignores diacritics and punctuation in searching; for example, use of "ʿ" is not required to find results with this diacritical mark. In addition, the dipthong "æ" and the vowel pair "ae" are treated as equivalent in search queries.

search-tips.p: To find an exact phrase, it should be enclosed in double quotes.

div.p:
Thus
"Byzantine pottery"
returns only results with that exact phrase, while several results are found for the words "Byzantine" without "pottery".

search-tips.p: To find two or more words which occur within a specified range of each other, one can append the character "~" followed by a number to an "Exact Phrase" search. This allows one to search for two or more words that occur within a specified distance of each other as defined by number of words. This search may find more results than a strict exact phrase search.

Thus
"Byzantine+pottery"~5
finds results in which the words "Byzantine" and "pottery" occur within five words of each other. This query finds more results than the search for the exact phrase "Byzantine pottery".
